messages.body: India has a hole where its middle class should be - India’s missing middle $aapl  https://www.economist.com/news/leaders/21734454-should-worry-both-government-and-companies-india-has-hole-where-its-middle-class-should-be

links.title: India has a hole where its middle class should be
links.description: AFTER China, where next? Over the past two decades, the world's most populous country has become the market qua non of just about every global company seeking growth. As its economy slows, businesses are looking for the next set of consumers to keep the tills ringing. To many, India feels like the heir apparent.

links.title: No Love For Facebook, As Amazon Continues Global Conquest
links.description: Well, that came out of left field. I was surprised by the broader market sell-off today. The Facebook sell-off, not so much. Afterall, I wrote on Saturday, that Facebook had been troubled now for some time, and I think this may only be beginning of a further decline.

links.title: Bigfry's Blog
links.description: Did you know that American options and European options differ in that American options can be exercised anytime before the expiration date, whereas European options can only be exercised at the expiration date? This means European options are cheaper than American options because American options have more options (pun intended).
